verses.verse: Then he said to Him, (Ex. 33:3) “If Your Presence does not go with us, do not bring us up from here.

For how then will it be known that Your people and I have found grace in Your sight, (Num. 14:14) except You go with us? So we (Ex. 34:10; Deut. 4:7, 34) shall be separate, Your people and I, from all the people who are upon the face of the earth.”
So the LORD said to Moses, ((James 5:16)) “I will also do this thing that you have spoken; for you have found grace in My sight, and I know you by name.”
And he said, “Please, show me (Ex. 24:16, 17; (1 Tim. 6:16)) Your glory.”

Then He said, “I will make all My (Ex. 34:6, 7) goodness pass before you, and I will proclaim the name of the LORD before you. ((Rom. 9:15, 16, 18)) I will be gracious to whom I will be ((Rom. 4:4, 16)) gracious, and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion.”
But He said, “You cannot see My face; for ((Gen. 32:30)) no man shall see Me, and live.”
And the LORD said, “Here is a place by Me, and you shall stand on the rock.
So it shall be, while My glory passes by, that I will put you (Song 2:14; Is. 2:21) in the cleft of the rock, and will (Ps. 91:1, 4; Is. 49:2; 51:16) cover you with My hand while I pass by.
Then I will take away My hand, and you shall see My back; but My face shall (Ex. 33:20; (John 1:18)) not be seen.”

Moses Makes New Tablets And the LORD said to Moses, ((Ex. 24:12; 31:18; 32:15, 16, 19; Deut. 4:13)) “Cut two tablets of stone like the first ones, and (Deut. 10:2, 4) I will write on these tablets the words that were on the first tablets which you broke.
So be ready in the morning, and come up in the morning to Mount Sinai, and present yourself to Me there (Ex. 19:11, 18, 20) on the top of the mountain.
And no man shall (Ex. 19:12, 13; 24:9-11) come up with you, and let no man be seen throughout all the mountain; let neither flocks nor herds feed before that mountain.”
So he cut two tablets of stone like the first ones. Then Moses rose early in the morning and went up Mount Sinai, as the LORD had commanded him; and he took in his hand the two tablets of stone.
Now the LORD descended in the (Ex. 19:9) cloud and stood with him there, and (Ex. 33:19) proclaimed the name of the LORD.

And the LORD passed before him and proclaimed, “The LORD, the LORD (Num. 14:18; Deut. 4:31; Neh. 9:17; Joel 2:13) God, merciful and gracious, longsuffering, and abounding in (Rom. 2:4) goodness and (Ps. 108:4) truth,

(Ex. 20:6) keeping mercy for thousands, (Ps. 103:3, 4; Dan. 9:9; Eph. 4:32; 1 John 1:9) forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, (Josh. 24:19; Job 10:14; Mic. 6:11; Nah. 1:3) by no means clearing the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children and the children’s children to the third and the fourth generation.”
So Moses made haste and (Ex. 4:31) bowed his head toward the earth, and worshiped.

Then he said, “If now I have found grace in Your sight, O Lord, (Ex. 33:12-16) let my Lord, I pray, go among us, even though we are a (Ex. 33:3) stiff-necked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us as (Ps. 33:12; 94:14) Your inheritance.”

The Covenant Renewed And He said: “Behold, (Ex. 34:27, 28; Deut. 5:2) I make a covenant. Before all your people I will (Deut. 4:32; Ps. 77:14) do marvels such as have not been done in all the earth, nor in any nation; and all the people among whom you are shall see the work of the LORD. For it is (Ps. 145:6) an awesome thing that I will do with you.

(Deut. 6:25) Observe what I command you this day. Behold, (Ex. 23:20-33; 33:2; Josh. 11:23) I am driving out from before you the Amorite and the Canaanite and the Hittite and the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite.
(Ex. 23:32, 33) Take heed to yourself, lest you make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land where you are going, lest it be a snare in your midst.
But you shall (Ex. 23:24; Deut. 12:3) destroy their altars, break their sacred pillars, and (Deut. 16:21; Judg. 6:25, 26; 2 Kin. 18:4; 2 Chr. 34:3, 4) cut down their wooden images
(for you shall worship ((Ex. 20:3-5)) no other god, for the LORD, whose ((Is. 9:6; 57:15)) name is Jealous, is a ((Ex. 20:5; Deut. 4:24)) jealous God),

lest you make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, and they (Judg. 2:17) play the harlot with their gods and make sacrifice to their gods, and one of them (Num. 25:1, 2; Deut. 32:37, 38) invites you and you (1 Cor. 8:4, 7, 10) eat of his sacrifice,

and you take of (Gen. 28:1; Deut. 7:3; Josh. 23:12, 13; 1 Kin. 11:2; Ezra 9:2; Neh. 13:25) his daughters for your sons, and his daughters (Num. 25:1, 2; 1 Kin. 11:4) play the harlot with their gods and make your sons play the harlot with their gods.
(Ex. 20:4, 23; 32:8; Lev. 19:4; Deut. 5:8) “You shall make no molded gods for yourselves.

“The Feast of (Ex. 12:15, 16) Unleavened Bread you shall keep. Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, in the appointed time of the (Ex. 12:2; 13:4) month of Abib; for in the month of Abib you came out from Egypt.
(Ex. 13:2; 22:29) “All that open the womb are Mine, and every male firstborn among your livestock, whether ox or sheep.

But (Ex. 13:13) the firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb. And if you will not redeem him, then you shall break his neck. All the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem. “And none shall appear before Me (Ex. 22:29; 23:15; Deut. 16:16) empty-handed.
(Ex. 20:9; 23:12; 31:15; 35:2; Lev. 23:3; Deut. 5:13) “Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall rest; in plowing time and in harvest you shall rest.
“And you shall observe the Feast of Weeks, of the firstfruits of wheat harvest, and the Feast of Ingathering at the year’s end.
(Ex. 23:14-17) “Three times in the year all your men shall appear before the Lord, the LORD God of Israel.

For I will ((Ex. 33:2); Josh. 11:23; 1 Kin. 4:21; 2 Chr. 36:14-16; Ps. 78:55) cast out the nations before you and enlarge your borders; neither will any man covet your land when you go up to appear before the LORD your God three times in the year.
“You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with leaven, (Ex. 12:10) nor shall the sacrifice of the Feast of the Passover be left until morning.
(Ex. 23:19; Deut. 26:2) “The first of the firstfruits of your land you shall bring to the house of the LORD your God. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.”
